net.sf.mmm.client.ui.base.dialog

Class AbstractDialogController<VIEW extends UiWidget>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.mmm.util.component.base.AbstractComponent
      • net.sf.mmm.util.component.base.AbstractLoggableComponent
        • net.sf.mmm.client.ui.base.dialog.AbstractDialogController<VIEW>
  • Type Parameters:
    VIEW - is the generic type of the view.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    AttributeReadVisible, AbstractDialog, AttributeReadId<String>, AttributeReadTitle<String>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DialogController

    public abstract class AbstractDialogController<VIEW extends UiWidget>
extends AbstractLoggableComponent
implements AbstractDialog
    This is the abstract base class for the controller of a Dialog or PopupDialog. It implements AbstractDialog as it represents the actual Dialog or PopupDialog and is its main entry point. A AbstractDialogController is supposed to be a lightweight component and construction shall be cheap and fast. It contains a view that is lazily created for performance reasons. The view can also be reseted to free resources or for testing hot-code changes during development. Therefore implementations have to properly reset their state in onReset().
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

    • Method Detail

      • isVisible

        public final boolean isVisible()
        This method determines if this dialog is currently visible (opened).
        Specified by:
        isVisible in interface AttributeReadVisible
        Specified by:
        isVisible in interface AbstractDialog
        Returns:
        true if visible, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        AttributeReadVisibleRecursive.isVisibleRecursive()

      • setVisible

        void setVisible(boolean visible)
        This method sets the visible flag and on change it triggers onShow() or onHide() accordingly.
        Parameters:
        visible - - true if this controller is about to show its view, false if it will hide it.

      • reset

        protected final void reset()
        This method resets this AbstractDialogController.

      • onReset

        protected void onReset()
        This method gets called whenever this controller is reseted. If you keep custom state information you need to override and reset your state.

      • onShow

        protected void onShow()
        This method gets called whenever the view is shown on the screen. It can be overridden to trigger custom logic - e.g. to update data.

      • onHide

        protected void onHide()
        This method gets called whenever the view is hidden from the screen. It can be overridden to trigger custom logics or to clean up resources.

      • createView

        protected abstract VIEW createView()
        This method creates the view and has to be implemented for each individual dialog.
        ATTENTION:
        This method can be called more than once.
        Returns:
        the new view.

      • getView

        public VIEW getView()
        This method gets the view of this AbstractDialogController. The view is the actual UI represented by a UiWidget.
        In most cases this will be a UiWidgetRegular. However, for specific controllers such as DialogConstants.TYPE_ROOT it may not be a regular widget.
        Returns:
        the view.
